events.1657: Murad proclaimed himself Emperor of India.
events.1872: Bhai Vir Singh, great poet, social worker, writer, educationist, musician, humanitarian and Padma Bhushan awardee, was born at Amritsar.
events.1898: Josh Malihabadi, famous Urdu poet, was born.
events.1905: Sheikh Muhammad Abdullah, former Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir, was born in Soura, Srinagar, Kashmir.
events.1931: Jayant G. Nadkarni, former Admiral of Indian Navy, was born.
events.1933: Balendu Shantilal Jain, famous hindi writer, was born at Kunchord, M.P.
events.1935: Bipinchandra Joshi, chief of Indian Army general, was born.
events.1943: The Japanese planes attack Calcutta port.
events.1950: Sri Aurobindo Ghosh, great revolutionary, freedom fighter and teacher, passed away.
events.1951: Abanindranath Tagore, a great Modern Indian Painter and sculptor, passed away in Calcutta.
events.1959: K. S. Duleepsinhji, cricketer (12 Tests for England, 995 runs), passed away.
events.1990: With the induction of 60 ministers, the Bihar Cabinet becomes the largest ever cabinet in India with a total of 71 ministers.
events.1991: The government reduces visa fees for tourists intending to visit India.
events.1992: V. P. Singh and hundreds arrested in Barabanki on the way to Ayodhya.
events.1993: Congress forms its seventh ministry in Madhya Pradesh. Digvijay Singh elected CM.
events.1994: V.P.Singh, former PM, resigns from the Parliament.
events.1998: Jaswant Singh and Pramod Mahajan take over as the new Foreign Minister and Minister for Information and Broadcasting. Jagmohan takes over as Minister for Communications.
events.1999: The Union Home Ministry ask Intelligence Bureau (IB) to conduct an inquiry against IB officials in ISRO spy case.
events.2000: Postal staff go on a nationwide indefinite strike which the Government termed as 'illegal'.
